p: Within the specific dataset when restricting the analysis to women 17–50 years old and adjusting for reporting country, pregnant women were less likely to die (IRR, 0.63; 95% CI, 0.41–0.96). Underlying conditions such as HIV/immunosuppression (IRR, 2.11; 95% CI, 1.48–3.03) or heart disease (IRR, 1.81; 95% CI, 1.12–2.91) increased the risk to die.
